Authors:
Xian dong Yu, Wei Dong, D J Bhat, Saranyaphat Boonmee, Di
Zhang, Huang Zhang
Title:
Cylindroconidiis aquaticus gen. et sp. nov., a new lineage of
aquatic hyphomycetes in Sclerococcaceae (Eurotiomycetes)
Keywords:
Asexual morph, Morphology, Multi-gene phylogeny, New taxa,
Taxonomy
Abstract:
During our ongoing investigations of freshwater fungi in
Thailand, Cylindroconidiis aquaticus gen. et sp. nov. is described in
the family Sclerococcaceae (Eurotiomycetes), based on morphological
characters and phylogenetic analyses of LSU, SSU and ITS sequence data.
Its closest relatives are Rhopalophora species and Fusichalara minuta.
The new genus is characterized by mononematous, unbranched
conidiophores, polyblastic, terminal or intercalary conidiogenous cells,
and ellipsoidal to cylindrical, 1-septate conidia. It is the first
report of freshwater fungi encountered in Sclerococcaceae.
